statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: N.C.-Asheville 85, Charleston Southern 73
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (AP) -- Reid Augst and Bryan Smithson scored 21 points apiece as North Carolina-Asheville snapped a four-game losing streak with an 85-73 victory over Charleston Southern on Saturday. Augst was 10-of-14 from the field for the Bulldogs (19-8, 8-4 Big South Conference), who set a school record for most victories during the regular season since the teams moved to NCAA Division I. UNC-Asheville won 18 games in the 1997-98 season. Reserve Kenny George had 15 points, and his three blocked shots set a single-season school record, topping the mark of 86 set by C.J. Walker in the 2003-04 season. The Bulldogs settled the game in the first half thanks to 61 percent field goal shooting on 19 of 31 attempts, including a 6-for-11 effort from 3-point range. The Buccaneers (9-18, 3-9) hit just 34.3 percent of their shots in the opening half. Charleston Southern closed a 44-30 halftime deficit to 63-58 on a layup by Giedrus Knysas with 9:02 to play, but the Bulldogs went on a 9-0 run over the next four minutes to shut down the rally. Vincent James scored 11 for UNC-Asheville. Chris Moore scored 18 to lead Charleston Southern, which got 17 from Jamarco Warren and 14 points and 10 rebounds from Tovi Bailey.
